entry.title: v1.3.0

entry.title: v1.1.1
entry.summary: Fixed: Item description didn't use the description property from feed item.

entry.title: v1.1.0
entry.summary: Added: MIT license Added: cache.json is stamped with the version of the builder. This allows future builder with breaking change to ignore incompatible cache. Added: Feed source retry on fetch error (3 times total, 15 seconds timeout). Added: Item enrichment retry on fetch error (3 times total, 15 seconds timeout). Added: Console log for cache restore and update behavior. Added: npx command: npx osmosfeed Changed: Improved console log that breaks down rendered item count into "new" and "cached". Fixed: Item…

entry.title: v1.0.1
entry.summary: Changed: Runtime dependencies are moved out of devDependencies. This is not a breaking change, but to receive performance benefit, you need to make sure @osmoscraft/osmosfeed is listed as dependencies instead of devDependencies in the package.json of your rss reader site. Changed: Build target from node12 to node14. Changed: Switched to a more robust rss parser: rss-parser Fixed: RSS 1.0 feed <dc:date> was not parsed as publish date. Chore: npm dependencies version updates.

entry.title: Internal Combustion Engine
entry.summary:
The invention of the internal combustion engine in the 19th century has revolutionized transportation over land, water, and air. Despite their omnipresence in modern day, the operation of an engine may be cryptic. Over the course of this article I’d like to explain the functionality of all the basic engine parts shown in the demonstration below. You can drag it around to see it from other angles:
This article has many interactive demonstrations which are best seen .

entry.title: COVID vaccines and blood clots: five key questions
entry.summary: It has been a difficult week for two COVID-19 vaccines. entry.title: Windows Package Manager v0.3 Preview
entry.summary: We have been hard at work building new experimental features for the Windows Package Manager. We have just released the Windows Package Manager v0.3 Preview. I would like to share the first major feature to exit experimental status. I also have the privilege of announcing support for Group Policy. The post Windows Package Manager v0.3 Preview appeared first on Windows Command Line.

entry.title: The Initial Preview of GUI app support is now available for the Windows Subsystem for Linux
entry.summary: A year ago at BUILD 2020 we introduced our goal to bring Linux GUI applications to the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) to run Linux GUI applications. We are proud to announce the first preview of this highly anticipated and open source feature! The post The Initial Preview of GUI app support is now available for the Windows Subsystem for Linux appeared first on Windows Command Line.

entry.title: What Can Wobbling Muons Tell Us About the Particles in our Universe?
entry.summary: Fermilab’s Dr. Adam Lyon breaks down the first results from the Muon g-2 experiment in this special public lecture, part of the Fermilab Arts and Lecture Series. entry.title: Novel theory addresses centuries-old physics problem
entry.summary: Hebrew University of Jerusalem Researcher introduces a new approach to the “three-body problem”; predicts its outcome statistics The “three-body problem,” the term coined for predicting the motion of three gravitating bodies in space, is essential for understanding a variety of astrophysical processes as well as a large class of mechanical problems, and has occupied some of […]
